entry.title: Startup42
entry.content:
Founded in 2013 by EPITA, Startup42 is a “fast & serious” project accelerator designed to offer hacker teams with a good idea the skills and opportunities they need to become startup founders, create an impactful product and actually sell it.

The Info Box  
🏢 Incubator Name StartUp42, or SU42
🌐 Location Kremlin-Bicêtre, France
🏰 Size NC
🛍 The “Petit plus” Startup42 is located in the HQs of EPITA and Epitech,
and benefit from the expertise of these two schools
💵 Price Free (no equity or hosting fee)

Created only 6 years ago, StartUp42 has already incubated nearly 51 startups, representing more than 200 jobs and 12 million euros. Behind all this, an expertise of engineers, developers and experts from all horizons, but also long-standing partners like FranceTV, Econocom and OpenDataSoft. StartUp42 is specialized in software : mobile/web apps, telecom, network, big data, cloud, SaaS with a focus on B2B.

From hackers to founders

StartUp42 provides an intense program for startups with a tech innovation. The typical profile is an engineer, developer or expert confirmed, with an innovative idea and the technical capabilities that go with it.

Everyone cannot join the program, there is a selection at the entrance but also during the incubation : If you are selected, you will be evaluated during the first two months at StartUp42. If this period is conclusive for your project, StartUp42 renews its partnership for 2 next months, with possibility to renew indefinitely and free of charge the partnership !

A bodybuilder program

By joining StartUp42, you will benefit from a daily follow-up on the design of your project, its commercial strategy or even its sales force. According to StartUp42, the acceleration is built around sequences of 4-weeks iterations divided in 2-weeks sprints of build and 2-weeks sprints of measuring the feedback and learning from them.

The goal of the first two weeks is to design a viable product, then to obtain during the other two weeks a customer client feedback to analyze and improve the product. Then, this cycle is renewed.

This is an original and condensed method but the results show that it is positive for incubated startups. I advise you to take a look at the manifesto of StartUp42, because after all, 42 is the answer to life the universe and everything !

🌐 Contact 🌐
StartUp42
18 Rue Pasteur
94270 Le Kremlin-Bicêtre
www.startup42.org/contact.html
entry.summary: Founded in 2013 by EPITA, Startup42 is a “fast & serious” project accelerator designed to offer hacker teams with a good idea the skills and opportunities they need to become startup founders, create an impactful product and actually sell it.

entry.title: Pépinière 27
entry.content:
With more than 100 startups incubated in a general and multi-disciplinary ecosystem, Pépinière 27 is a Parisian incubator offering both a flexible hosting and support services, but also a rich and inspiring infrastructure, like a natural greenhouse where knowledge flourishes.

The Info Box  
🏢 Incubator Name Pépinière 27
🌐 Location Paris, France
🏰 Size 3500 m2 of offices, 100 m2 of common areas
+ gym room, relaxation area, …
🔢 Startups incubated 100
🛍 The “Petit plus” Pépinière 27 is labeled “Paris Innovation” by the City of Paris
+ Access to the “PIA” (Paris Innovation Amorçage) funding program
💵 Price Starting at 250€/month

What’s more inspiring than a natural-looking greenhouse with an important infrastructure and quality accommodation, all in the heart of Paris ? Powered by the Paris Innovation label, Pépinière 27 is the ultimate friendly incubator with nearly 4 million euros raised by only 8 startups of the incubator.

In this friendly ecosystem, you have the choice between open or closed offices according to your needs, with a large common area free co-working, a waiting room, 9 meeting rooms fully equipped and relaxation areas (gym, patio). The team is composed of only 10 people with always a presence in the HQ.

An accompanying offer

Providing to startups an offer of hosting to work is something great, but an incubator would not be an incubator if it did not offer a continuous support. Thus, Pépinière 27 offers business workshops, networking meetings, conferences, networking with experts in your field, as well as an access to a social platform bringing together all incubated startups.

Pépinière 27 offers 3 programs for startups. Offices open starting at 560€/month (+ fees) or private (starting at 680€/month + fees) with the possibility of joining the Associate Program, allowing you to get :

  • A postal address at 27 rue du Chemin Vert (Paris 75011) with the management of your receptions and mailings stamped.
  • A permanent access badge to the premises (24h/24 and 7/7)
  • An access to the meeting rooms for the reception of your customers (according to availability)
  • A permanent access to the gym room
  • An access to the cafeteria
  • A profile of your company on the Pépinière 27’s intranet (news feed, events, meeting rooms booking, chat, …)

Certified Paris Innovation by the City of Paris

As a Paris Innovation certified incubator by the Paris City Hall, startups located in Pépinière 27 can apply for a funding with Paris Innovation Amorçage funding program. Created to support the development of startups hosted in incubators labeled Paris Innovation, it is aimed at any innovative project in the seed or development phase. Do not hesitate to consult the detailed presentation of this program and to contact, as the case may be, the Paris Regional Office of Bpifrance Île de France.

To learn more about Pépinière 27, the reception is open from 9am to 6:30pm, if you want to have a preview of the atmosphere and the place, don’t hesitate to go there. It’s only 5 minutes from the Place de la Bastille !

🌐 Contact 🌐
Pépinière 27
27 Rue du chemin vert
75013 Paris
+33 (0)1 75 77 87 00
contact@pepiniere27.fr
entry.summary: With more than 100 startups incubated in a general and multi-disciplinary ecosystem, Pépinière 27 is a Parisian incubator offering both a flexible hosting and support services, but also a rich and inspiring infrastructure, like a natural greenhouse where knowledge flourishes.

entry.title: NUMA
entry.content:
Not just an open space for entrepreneurs, NUMA is an international hub of more than 300 organizations, including CAC40 leaders and hundreds of startups. Training and follow-up are at the heart of NUMA’s philosophy.

The Info Box  
🏢 Incubator Name NUMA
🌐 Location Paris, France
🔢 Startups incubated 300
🛍 The “Petit plus” NUMA offers a free open-space with bar on the ground floor
💵 Price Free co-working space
Privatization of rooms from 1200€/day

It all started in 2000 with Silicon Sentier, an entrepreneur association with more than 180 partner companies. Their initial objective was to encourage meetings between entrepreneurs and to allow new projects to emerge and floor on the Next Big Thing. The idea was to design a network capable of promoting and facilitating the development of entrepreneurship at the national level, and that’s what became NUMA today.

NUMA is not only an open space for entrepreneurs or small businesses today, it’s a hub of more than 300 organizations, including CAC40 leaders and hundreds of startups - with a presence in Paris, Barcelona, Mexico, Toulouse, Berlin and even New York.

Not only an open-space

The first time I went to NUMA, it was just to have a place where to discuss professionally with other students, entrepreneurs and business leaders, I also discovered a free space co-working on the ground floor, with possibility to rent different rooms for private meetings.

But my biggest surprise was to discover the “formations”. Today, the challenge is not only to master the technical aspect of a project but also the notions of management, intrapreneurship, design thinking and digital marketing. And guess what? That’s exactly what NUMA offers. In fact, we understand quickly that we do not invest only in a HQ or a place to work, but in a long-term support of your project.

“To infinity and beyond”

Regarding the incubation program, NUMA brings its expertise to startups already on the market and having a consequent turnover, for 3.5 % equity participation. NUMA’s philosophy is based on the development of the startups’ business and network, the implementation of a rigorous and effective methodology for executing their strategy as well as long-term support through a mentoring system with experts.

Looking for something fun to do there, to discover the atmosphere of NUMA ? Do not hesitate to visit “La Cantine”, the first collaborative workspace created in Île-de-France Region, where many celebrities have passed to make conferences and exchange with members, like Mark Zuckerberg.

🌐 Contact 🌐
NUMA Paris
39 Rue du Caire
75002 Paris
+33 (0)1 40 13 64 40
entry.summary: Not just an open space for entrepreneurs, NUMA is an international hub of more than 300 organizations, including CAC40 leaders and hundreds of startups. Training and follow-up are at the heart of NUMA’s philosophy.

entry.title: La Ruche
entry.content:
La Ruche (hive in English) is a network of incubators dedicated to social innovation. Its action includes co-working, incubation, events, but also the establishment of large-scale partnerships allowing each actor or startup to give birth to his project or idea in the best conditions, be it at Paris, in the region or in the whole of France with different “hives”.

The Info Box  
🏢 Incubator Name La Ruche
🌐 Location Paris - Saint-Germain-en-Laye, France
🏰 Size 3200 m2
🔢 Startups incubated 125 projects per year
🛍 The “Petit plus” La Ruche offers an incubation program for women in tech,
called “Les Audacieuses” and member of the Tech for Good project
💵 Price Starting at 145€/month

Launched 11 ago with the conviction that a responsible and collaborative society was possible, La Ruche offers a range of services for entrepreneurs and young startups, from incubation to growth through advice and co-working spaces in all France.

“The Place to Bee”

From hackatons to half-day to several days trainings, La Ruche offers a range of support for entrepreneurs and startups. In 1 year, more than 125 projects were incubated with an 83% survival rate of incubated entrepreneurs in the first 3 years.

Regarding the workspaces, I will focus on HQs in Île-de-France and Paris Region, but La Ruche also has workspaces in Bordeaux, Marseille, Saint-Nazaire, Montpellier and more.

With 3200m² dedicated to the positive economy and a terrace of more than 200m² in Paris, La Ruche welcomes project leaders driven by social entrepreneurship, digital technology and culture. You find an astonishing diversity among co-workers, such as entrepreneurs, associations, employees, teleworkers, self-employed and intrapreneurs. Each category has its own tariff range adapted to its needs.

Programs for all

La Ruche offers special rates for everyone, and offers 5 programs :

  • Closed offices (starting 1k€/month) with offices for up to 20 people, with a commitment of 6 months and unlimited access.
  • Full time program (starting at 350€/month) with unlimited access, a fixed office for 1 person and a 3-month commitment.
  • Half time program (starting at 235€/month) with an access 20 half-days (or 10 days per month), a fixed office for 1 person and a 2-month commitment.
  • Quarter time program (starting at 145€/month) with an access 10 half-days (or 5 days per month), a fixed office for 1 person and a 2-month commitment.
  • Full time company program (starting at 500€/month) with unlimited access and more.

Startups have free Internet, printer, an access to 9 meeting rooms, a 220m² terrace, a kitchen/sleep room, training sessions, an access to meeting-space for your public events and of course, national professionals from La Ruche’s network.

Le + : As a Paris Innovation certified incubator by the Paris City Hall, startups located in La Ruche can apply for a funding with Paris Innovation Amorçage funding program. Created to support the development of startups hosted in incubators labeled Paris Innovation, it is aimed at any innovative project in the seed or development phase. Do not hesitate to consult the detailed presentation of this program and to contact, as the case may be, the Paris Regional Office of Bpifrance Île de France.

🌐 Contact 🌐
La Ruche® Paris
24 Rue de l’Est
75020 Paris
paris@la-ruche.net
+33 (0)1 83 64 59 04
entry.summary: La Ruche (hive in English) is a network of incubators dedicated to social innovation. Its action includes co-working, incubation, events, but also the establishment of large-scale partnerships allowing each actor or startup to give birth to his project or idea in the best conditions, be it at Paris, in the region or in the whole of France with different “hives”.

entry.title: IncubAlliance
entry.content:
Incubator of the Paris-Saclay cluster since 2005, IncubAlliance’s main mission is to create bridges between startups, companies, labor and research experts within the Paris-Saclay campus, through support, training and hosting services for startups and education stakeholders.

The Info Box  
🏢 Incubator Name IncubAlliance
🌐 Location Orsay, France
🏰 Size NC
🔢 Startups incubated 404 incubated projects and 310 startups created
🛍 The “Petit plus” Incubated startups work closely
with universities and companies from Paris-Saclay HQ
💵 Price NC

Located in the Paris-Saclay campus, a major hub of French innovation and the world’s 8th largest innovation cluster, IncubAlliance has been working for many years on the creation of innovative technology entrepreneurial projects at national and global level. In 2018, IncubAlliance incubated 42 new projects and 18 startups were created : that represents nearly 700 jobs for a survival rate of 95% (over 5 years), which is consistent.

This incubator is the result of many years of questioning about how higher education institutions (universities, engineering schools) should manage their postgraduate students who wanted to start their own business.

By integrating the Paris-Saclay technology cluster, incubated startups work closely with students from neighboring schools or partners, and benefit from the expertise of 15% of French public and private research.

Support for startups…

The IncubAlliance program for startups is simple and accurate :

  • Providing a 35-day training program where experts help fine-tune one’s project, in workshop format, before a startup is definitively launched (called GenesisLab).
  • Providing a 22-month support program, which includes coaching and group workshops, to steer startups toward their first product launch and sales (called Incub22).
  • Financing projects throughout the entire incubation period to cover external and outsourced services.
  • Giving an incubation program certification (recognized by France).
  • Offering shared or private accommodation for all teams in the Paris-Saclay HQ.
  • Proposing collaborators and experts from Paris-Saclay universities, companies or laboratories.

Customized offers “Sur mesure” are of course available according to the needs of startups.

…And for companies

A developed company can also benefit from IncubAlliance’s advantages, such as :

  • Providing a privileged access to IncubAlliance’s services and the tech startup network.
  • Giving a complete excubation program specially designed for companies’ and institutions’ needs.
  • Providing the GenesisLab program described above.
  • Providing a 8-day program with an introduction to technological entrepreneurship with a project underway (called GenesisLight).
  • Organizing meet-ups between startups, companies and research institutions.

In addition to all this, some programs are eligible for professional training financing solutions. The funding comes mainly from the European Union, the Île-de-France region and the Ministry of Higher Education of France. Regarding the cost, it depends on the needs of startups but on average, it amounts to about 7000€ on the entire program.

🌐 Contact 🌐
IncubAlliance Paris-Saclay
86 Rue de Paris
91400 Orsay
contact@incuballiance.fr
+33 (0)1 77 93 21 00
entry.summary: Incubator of the Paris-Saclay cluster since 2005, IncubAlliance’s main mission is to create bridges between startups, companies, labor and research experts within the Paris-Saclay campus, through support, training and hosting services for startups and education stakeholders.

entry.title: AgoraNov
entry.content:
Founded more than 16 years ago, AgoraNov is one of the largest incubators in Île-de-France and France with more than 300 incubated startups, including successful companies such as the advertising giant Criteo, the doctor appointment management app Doctolib or the world robotics giant Aldebaran (now SoftBank Robotics). The incubator is also sponsored by many universities and public companies around the country.

The Info Box  
🏢 Incubator Name AgoraNov
🌐 Location Paris, France
🏰 Size 2000 m²
🔢 Startups incubated 320+ incubated projects and 300+ startups created
🛍 The “Petit plus” AgoraNov has incubated successful companies like
Criteo, Biophytis, Aldebaran, Doctolib and more.
💵 Price NC

A key player in the entrepreneurship and innovation sector and launched 16 years ago, AgoraNov is a public incubator of startups with a strong technological identity. The incubator was founded by the UPMC University (now Sorbonne University, do not hesitate to read my full article about it), Paris-Dauphine University, ENS, ParisTech and INRIA – and fully supported by the Ministry of Research and Higher Education, the Île-de-France Region, the City of Paris and the European Social Fund.

In less than 20 years, AgoraNov has raised more than 500 million euros of private funds for more than 320 incubated projects and 300 companies in the areas of digital technology, healthcare, industry and “greentech”. On the 320 incubated projects, nearly 170 have been awarded by the Ministry of Higher Education and Research of France.

Agoranov simultaneously supports some 60 startups that benefit from personalized support, the possibility of being hosted in the heart of Paris, an acceleration program and the expertise of a community of more than 300 startups, including some “pépites” like Criteo and Doctolib.

A very selective and condensed program

One of the particularities of AgoraNov compared to its competitors is the very strong selection at the entrance with only 60 projects incubated per year over a period of 24 months.

To join AgoraNov, you have to fill out a very complete form presenting your project. The form will be validated or not by the AgoraNov team, you will then have to present your project to the Incubator Expert Committee and if your project is accepted, an agreement is signed between AgoraNov and your team. You will understand that an Olympic preparation is necessary to join AgoraNov !

What does AgoraNov bring ?

The AgoraNov program is specific to each company and each domain (hopefully) but in general, the incubator will bring personality coaching by an experienced team from different fields.

With this you will also have accommodation with closed or open offices in the heart of Paris, you will have an infrastructure of more than 2000m², including meeting rooms, open-spaces, workspaces, relaxation areas and a reception. You will of course be able to exchange with other companies present on the spot and benefit from targeted trainings (meetings with partners, investors, industrialists or experts of the sector).

“We have an appetite for more technological projects, but as we are open to all sectors, it creates synergies between web start-ups and those that are more tech”
- David Argellies, Chargé d’affaires at AgoraNov.

If AgoraNov is distinguished from others by being a public incubator, it’s also a real creator of “French pépites” - these successful companies that we see more and more in our lives. And that’s just the beginning !

Le + : For the past few years, AgoraNov has been involved in the “Startups at School” project, which aims to bring school audiences and young innovative companies closer together in the context of educational projects conceived in various school subjects.

🌐 Contact 🌐
AgoraNov
96bis Boulevard Raspail
75006 Paris
courrier@agoranov.com
+ 33 (0)1 44 18 07 15
entry.summary: Founded more than 16 years ago, AgoraNov is one of the largest incubators in Île-de-France and France with more than 300 incubated startups, including successful companies such as the advertising giant Criteo, the doctor appointment management app Doctolib or the world robotics giant Aldebaran (now SoftBank Robotics). The incubator is also sponsored by many universities and public companies around the country.
